title: InkLink

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: InkLink is a platform for collaborative storytelling, enabling writers to extend, remix, and contribute to shared narratives. Our goal was to create an experience that is social, playful, and editorial, supporting participation without overwhelming users. This project was team-based, with contributions across design, illustration, and front-end development.

problem.title: Research & Ideation
problem.description: We began by understanding the audience through competitive analysis of existing writing tools, surveys with writers and creative communities, and workshop sessions to identify needs and pain points. Key insight: Writers wanted inspiration and connectivity, not just a blank canvas. Lo‑fi sketches and user journeys in Figma mapped early flows for story creation, contribution, and exploration.

objectives: Create an experience that is social, playful, and editorial
Enable writers to extend, remix, and contribute to shared narratives

solution.title: Final Solution
solution.description: Editorial layout with asymmetry, whitespace, and modular sections. Interactive hover previews where images/videos float freely with snappy motion. Team visuals give personality and emphasize collaboration. Built in Framer using Figma and Illustrator assets. Motion supports storytelling, not just decoration—negative space and editorial layout enhance readability.

designProcess.title: Early Concepts
activities: Wireframed navigation, story discovery, and contribution screens
Feedback highlighted confusion around entry points

designProcess.title: Progressive Refinement
activities: Simplified flow so exploration is default state
Highlighted CTAs for joining stories with motion and scale
Removed containers; visuals float in whitespace

designProcess.title: Micro-Interactions
activities: Snappy hover previews with diagonal motion

designProcess.title: Framer Development
activities: Built in Framer with Figma/Illustrator assets
Team collaboration across design and development

outcomes.title: Impact & Reflection
outcomes.description: Successfully communicates collaborative creativity while balancing expressive visuals with usability. Shows strong team collaboration and iterative design process. Lessons learned: Motion supports storytelling, not just decoration. Negative space and editorial layout enhance readability. Iterations from lo-fi to high-fi are essential for clarity and polish.
